Title: Sustainable and Healthy Food Solutions: System Dynamics and Trade-offs (FLORA Project)

The FLORA project proposes a transformative approach to global agri-food production, trade, and consumption, prioritizing sustainability, health, and environmental stewardship. Our objectives are threefold: contribute to a system-wide transformation, generate evidence to inform practice and behavior change, and identify targeted solutions that balance trade-offs and synergies. To achieve these goals, we will employ a systemic and interdisciplinary approach, integrating complex network analyses, system dynamics modeling, and expert knowledge. Our global scope will facilitate a comprehensive diagnosis of the health and environmental outcomes of food systems, identification of key threats and opportunities, and evaluation of tailored solutions. By considering the intricate dynamics between agriculture, food production, trade, consumption, and the environment, we will develop effective strategies to mitigate the negative impacts of the agri-food system while promoting healthy and sustainable food solutions. The FLORA project builds on the PI's established track record in leading interdisciplinary research on the global agri-food system, ensuring a high likelihood of success and significant scientific and societal impact.

Title: Sustainable and Healthy Food Solutions: System Dynamics and Trade-offs (FLORA Project)

The FLORA project proposes a transformative approach to address the complex challenges facing the global agri-food system. Our objective is to contribute to a sustainable and healthy food future by identifying and implementing evidence-based solutions that balance human health, environmental sustainability, and food security. To achieve this, we will employ a systemic and interdisciplinary approach, leveraging system dynamics and complex network analyses to diagnose the integrated health and environmental outcomes of food systems globally. We will identify key threats and opportunities, and target tailored solutions using an inter-disciplinary modelling framework. Our project will provide essential evidence to inform policy and practice, enabling the identification of effective, targeted solutions that consider trade-offs, synergies, and dynamics. With a global scope, the FLORA project will focus on sustainability, health, environment, agriculture, food production, trade, and consumption. By building on the PI's excellent track record in leading interdisciplinary research, this project will drive a paradigm shift towards a more sustainable and healthy food future.

Title: FLORA Project - Sustainable and Healthy Food Solutions: System Dynamics and Trade-Offs

The FLORA project aims to contribute to a fundamental transformation of global agri-food production, trade, and consumption to ensure sustainable and healthy food solutions. This innovative project will provide essential evidence to identify and implement shifts in practices and behaviors, enabling the identification of effective, targeted solutions that consider trade-offs, synergies, and dynamics. Through a systemic approach, we will diagnose the integrated health and environmental outcomes of food systems globally, identifying key threats and opportunities using system dynamics and complex network analyses. Our interdisciplinary modeling framework will target and evaluate tailored solutions, focusing on sustainability, health, environment, agriculture, food production, trade, and consumption. With a global scope, this project will inform decision-makers, policymakers, and stakeholders on how to navigate complex trade-offs and optimize food system outcomes. By integrating knowledge from multiple disciplines, we will develop a comprehensive understanding of the global agri-food system, ultimately contributing to a more sustainable, healthy, and food-secure future.
